question:
The Economist Intelligence Unit has released the Global Liveability Index 2019. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Austriaâ€™s Vienna topped the index.
  2. None of the Indian cities feature in the top 100 countries listed by the index.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The index considers ranks 140 countries annually based on their living conditions. For the second time in a row, Vienna of Austria has been listed as the most liveable city. Some of the parameters considered by the index include education, infrastructure, stability, culture, environment, etc. Statement 2 is correct: None of the Indian states feature in the top 100 countries. Delhi has dropped to 118th rank while Mumbai has dropped to the 119th ranks. Some of the reasons for drop in performance of Indian cities include worsening of living conditions, increased crime rate, abuse against journalists etc.
